Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels
Evidence Statements: The student can include different plants and animals in their drawing.
The student can illustrate places where different plants and animals live.
The student can show what plants and animals need to survive, like water, air, and land resources.
The student can demonstrate how animals and plants use their environment to meet their needs, such as fish needing water to swim.
The student can depict the connection between plants, animals, and the resources they depend on in their habitats.
The student can illustrate how plants and animals are each part of a system, showing how they work together to live.
The student can label the parts of their drawing to identify plants, animals, and resources clearly.
